graph.author: Asis

cards.helptext:
Never add extra empty spaces at the end or beginning

YYYY-MM-DD (when no DD, leave it blank, always write full years (e.g. ‘1751-1758’)

  • Date not sure: use ‘?’ at the end of the numbers (e.g. ‘1795-1801?’)
  • If century uncertain: use ‘xx’ (e.g., ‘19xx’ = an uncertain year in the 19th century)
  • If approximate date: use ‘~’ before the number (e.g., ‘~2018-2019’ or ‘2018-~05-26’)
  • If several years: use comma + space (e.g., ‘1617, 1620, 1701’)
  • If alternative years: use [date]   (e.g. ‘[1706, 1708]’, i.e. either 1706 or 1708)
  • For all other cases use the Rich Text Field below
cards.helptitle: For dates strictly the use the following formats
cards.instructions: For date : Never add extra empty spaces at the end or beginning.  YYYY-MM-DD (when no DD, leave it blank, always write full years (e.g. ‘1751-1758’) ).  Date not sure: use ? at the end of the numbers (e.g. ‘1795-1801?’).  If century uncertain: use ‘xx’ (e.g., ‘19xx’ = an uncertain year in the 19th century).  If approximate date: use ‘~’ before the number (e.g., ‘~2018-2019’ or ‘2018-~05-26’).  If several years: use comma + space (e.g., ‘1617, 1620, 1701’).  If alternative years: use [date]   (e.g. ‘[1706, 1708]’, i.e. either 1706 or 1708).  For all other cases use the Rich Text Field below.
cards.name: Object typology

cards.helptext:
Good: Very few light surface damages, renovated or repaired;

Slightly damaged: minor damages such as minor cracks, plants, missing stones in plinths;

Heavily damaged: collapsed, demolished, major cracks and structural damages.
cards.name: CONDITION ASSESSMENT

cards.helptext:
How to insert image captions

Copy and add in RTF and Primary Image:


If not otherwise stated, all images and texts in this monument folder are published under Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 License (CC BY-SA 4.0), and the copyright lies with NHDP. All visuals of this monument folder and more are (or will be) also stored in heidICON, the object and multimedia database of Heidelberg University. (Type the ID-number or key words in the first line and click the search field.) You will also find the initial report there. The latest report will always be available in DANAM (this page).

Please note:

  • If there are more than one photographer or draftsmen, please list the names divided by comma.
  • Date: Possible formats: yyyy-mm-dd, yy-mm, yyyy, yyyy-yyyy, ca. yyyy
  • Copyright and license will be added by default at primary image only

1. Primary image and photos from NHDP

[ Name of monument ], view from [ direction ]; photo by [ first name(s) surname ]; [ date ]

Example:

Kvātha Bāhāḥ, southern side of the Bāhaḥ with a statue of Padmapāṇi Lokeśvara, view from N; photo by Yogesh Budathoki; 2020-08-04

2. Non-NHDP visuals (including historical photos)

[ Name of monument ], view from [ direction ]; photo [ or painting or graphic ] by [ first name(s) surname ]; [ date ]; courtesy of [ first name(s), surname ]; free access – no reuse; source: [ name of author, first name + surname, short title, year, page number ]

Examples:

Bhindyaḥ Bāhāḥ with Nugaḥ Bhindyaḥ (Bhīmasena) in the south, view from E; photo by Niels Gutschow; 2020-08-04; courtesy of Niels Gutschow; Free access – no reuse

Kvātha Bāhāḥ, view from NW; photo by Carl Pruscha; 1973–1974; courtesy of Carl Pruscha; free access – no reuse; source [only if the photo has been published]: Carl Pruscha, Kathmandu Valley, 1975, vol. II, p. 199 (P-256)

3. Maps & Drawings & Plans

[ Name of monument ]; [ select: ] location map / floor plan / site plan / elevation drawing / section drawing / sketch by [ first name(s) surname ]; [ date ]; updated [ if necessary ] by [ first name surname: [ name ], [ update-date ]

Examples

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; location map by Niels Gutschow, Bijay Basukala; 1990; updated by Vivek Basukala, 2020-08-04

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; floor plan by Bijay Basukala; 2020-08-04

Further examples for maps and plans including source:

If the copyright lies not at NHDP (maps before 2018):

Jalavināyaka Mandira; floor plan by Sushil Rajbhandari; 1998, Courtesy of Sushil Rajbhandari; Free access – no reuse; updated by Thomas Schrom; 06-2020

If the copyright lies at NHDP (maps after 2018):

Hayagrīva Mandira; site plan by Danish Architect Student Group; 1968; free access - no reuse; updated by Thomas Schrom, 2020; source: Danish Nepal Group, Bungmati 1968, 1968, p. 19.

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; location map by Niels Gutschow, Bijay Basukala; 2000-01-20; updated by: Vivek Basukala, 2020-08-04.

Please select event name from the event categories listed below:

  • Conseration
  • Demolition/Dismantling
  • Theft
  • Initial construction/creation
  • Modification/expansion
  • Destruction
  • Donation
  • Land grant
  • Reconstruction
  • Restoration/repair
  • Ritual participation
  • Other event category

cards.instructions: Refer to help for filling out "Image caption"
cards.name: Source image(s)

cards.helptext:
• Short description : The first 30 -34 words should be a standardized paragraph and used for a summary of important information and should contain : Alternative Names, Location and Age of the Monument (up to maximum 180 characters with space).

 

  • Detailed description: Description of the monument should follow the following structure: location, size, context and iconographical peculiarities, history, anthropological information and present condition.  
  • Do not just quote Pruscha and look for history into the relevant literature. Link authors name to Zotero: mark the name, make it bold, click on the chain symbol, go to target, select ‚New Window (blank)‘, OK, Select in Zotero the title, copy the link and enter the URL in DAMAM; the author name should then appear in blue color). Write the author’s name year, page no.
cards.instructions: Short description : The first 30 -34 words should be a standardized paragraph and used for a summary of important information and should contain : Alternative Names, Location and Age of the Monument (up to maximum 180 characters with space). See also help for Description.
cards.name: DESCRIPTION

Never add extra empty spaces at the end or beginning

YYYY-MM-DD (when no DD, leave it blank, always write full years (e.g. ‘1751-1758’)

  • Date not sure: use ‘?’ at the end of the numbers (e.g. ‘1795-1801?’)
  • If century uncertain: use ‘xx’ (e.g., ‘19xx’ = an uncertain year in the 19th century)
  • If approximate date: use ‘~’ before the number (e.g., ‘~2018-2019’ or ‘2018-~05-26’)
  • If several years: use comma + space (e.g., ‘1617, 1620, 1701’)
  • If alternative years: use [date]   (e.g. ‘[1706, 1708]’, i.e. either 1706 or 1708)
  • For all other cases use the Rich Text Field below

cards.instructions: Refer to help for the instruction to fill "Caption"
cards.name: Object basic data

cards.helptext: Select the appropriate, municipality has to be filled. Always mention the ṭol or monument area name. Setting the Spatial Coordinates Geometry: type in 'Search': Lalitpur, Bagmati, Nepal - confirm - enlarge until Patan becomes visible on the map, press violet circle on the right top, select satellite mode, search for the place on the map, tip on the marker in the sign bar (6th from bottom), set the cursor to the location on the map, click (a red dot must be seen); if mistake, click on the red bottom and then on the trash sign in the bar.
cards.name: LOCATIONS

cards.helptext: First name in Roman with Diacritics (write ‚Mandira‘ instead of ‚Temple‘ but in the anglicised form use ‚Temple‘). Alternative names: all other names with diacritics, Anglicized name: no diacritics, name in Devanagari (add // + Id-no.)
cards.instructions: ***NOTE: Please Search the Monument before proceeding with the data entry to avoid the duplication of data.***

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; floor plan by Bijay Basukala; 2020-08-04

Further examples for maps and plans including source:

If the copyright lies not at NHDP (maps before 2018):

Jalavināyaka Mandira; floor plan by Sushil Rajbhandari; 1998, Courtesy of Sushil Rajbhandari; Free access – no reuse; updated by Thomas Schrom; 06-2020

If the copyright lies at NHDP (maps after 2018):

Hayagrīva Mandira; site plan by Danish Architect Student Group; 1968; free access - no reuse; updated by Thomas Schrom, 2020; source: Danish Nepal Group, Bungmati 1968, 1968, p. 19.

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; location map by Niels Gutschow, Bijay Basukala; 2000-01-20; updated by: Vivek Basukala, 2020-08-04.
cards.instructions: Refer to help for the instruction to fill "Image caption"
cards.name: Additional images

cards.helptext:
How to insert image captions

Copy and add in RTF and Primary Image:


If not otherwise stated, all images and texts in this monument folder are published under Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 License (CC BY-SA 4.0), and the copyright lies with NHDP. All visuals of this monument folder and more are (or will be) also stored in heidICON, the object and multimedia database of Heidelberg University. (Type the ID-number or key words in the first line and click the search field.) You will also find the initial report there. The latest report will always be available in DANAM (this page).

Please note:

  • If there are more than one photographer or draftsmen, please list the names divided by comma.
  • Date: Possible formats: yyyy-mm-dd, yy-mm, yyyy, yyyy-yyyy, ca. yyyy
  • Copyright and license will be added by default at primary image only

1. Maps & Drawings & Plans

[ Name of monument ]; [ select: ] location map / floor plan / site plan / elevation drawing / section drawing / sketch by [ first name(s) surname ]; [ date ]; updated [ if necessary ] by [ first name surname: [ name ], [ update-date ]

Examples

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; location map by Niels Gutschow, Bijay Basukala; 1990; updated by Vivek Basukala, 2020-08-04

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; floor plan by Bijay Basukala; 2020-08-04

Further examples for maps and plans including source:

If the copyright lies not at NHDP (maps before 2018):

Jalavināyaka Mandira; floor plan by Sushil Rajbhandari; 1998, Courtesy of Sushil Rajbhandari; Free access – no reuse; updated by Thomas Schrom; 06-2020

If the copyright lies at NHDP (maps after 2018):

Hayagrīva Mandira; site plan by Danish Architect Student Group; 1968; free access - no reuse; updated by Thomas Schrom, 2020; source: Danish Nepal Group, Bungmati 1968, 1968, p. 19.

Kvātha Bāhāḥ; location map by Niels Gutschow, Bijay Basukala; 2000-01-20; updated by: Vivek Basukala, 2020-08-04.

2. Primary image and photos from NHDP

[ Name of monument ], view from [ direction ]; photo by [ first name(s) surname ]; [ date ]

Example:

Kvātha Bāhāḥ, southern side of the Bāhaḥ with a statue of Padmapāṇi Lokeśvara, view from N; photo by Yogesh Budathoki; 2020-08-04

3. Non-NHDP visuals (including historical photos)

[ Name of monument ], view from [ direction ]; photo [ or painting or graphic ] by [ first name(s) surname ]; [ date ]; courtesy of [ first name(s), surname ]; free access – no reuse; source: [ name of author, first name + surname, short title, year, page number ]

Examples:

Bhindyaḥ Bāhāḥ with Nugaḥ Bhindyaḥ (Bhīmasena) in the south, view from E; photo by Niels Gutschow; 2020-08-04; courtesy of Niels Gutschow; Free access – no reuse

Kvātha Bāhāḥ, view from NW; photo by Carl Pruscha; 1973–1974; courtesy of Carl Pruscha; free access – no reuse; source [only if the photo has been published]: Carl Pruscha, Kathmandu Valley, 1975, vol. II, p. 199 (P-256)
cards.instructions: Keep conventions (examples) for the captions of maps and plants etc. (IMPORTANT) please refer help. Refer to help as well for filling out "Caption"

Photography after 2015:

Drawings and architectural data:

Historical events, inscriptions:
cards.name: DOCUMENTATION TEAM

cards.helptext:
References: for inscriptions write “Inscription of + Inscription ID no. in brackets. Secondary literature: only mention author year, page(s) and link to Zotero

Images: this field is only for images depicting the event itself, not for inscriptions!

For additional Historical Events click on the uppermost ‘+’ besides HIOSTORICA LEVENTS
cards.name: HISTORICAL EVENT AND PAST INTERVENTIONS
